headline: Crumb Topping for Pies
description: This simple and delicious crumb topping, or streusel, is the perfect recipe for topping your favorite desserts, like pies, muffins, and coffee cakes.
name: Crumb Topping for Pies

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together sugar and flour in a medium bowl. Cut in butter with a fork or stand mixer just until the topping is crumbly.

review.reviewBody: Awful! The worst crumb topping I’ve ever made! If there were a way to give negative stars it would be -5 (minus five).

I made banana bread in a rectangular pan and it occurred to me that it might be pretty to give it a coarse crumb sprinkle over the top. This topping tasted delicious but it was too fine which went on very even, and resulted in a homogeneous coating that you could lift up in sheets, for lack of a better term. My husband loved it but he thought it was coffee cake. It’s important that the butter be cold to stay in large pieces and I would even add some rolled oats.
It was quick and simple. delicious topping.

I don't know if I did something wrong. I made it exactly as directed. It was very dry and floury. It didn't crisp up at all. I ended up shaking much of it off. If I try this again, I'm going to cut the flour in half and double the butter.
Very good, but needed to double the butter. Came out like sand
It's easy to make, and works well. I used it for a mini pie, so I only made about a quarter of the recipe.

Excellent! Basic but you can add to it (chopped pecans or walnuts, oats, dried cranberries, etc.) Can be made ahead (in bulk if you want) and frozen - ready at a moments notice for those spontaneous pie-making needs!
Didn't feel like this was crunchy or crumbly enough, more like a sweet dusting. Will try again while adding oats.
I've used this topping several times and loved it. It is my "go-to."
Easy in kitchen aid mixer!

Based on other reviews I cut this back to 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup flour and kept it at 1/4 cup butter. I added a dash of cinnamon. Topping for a cherry pie. Consistency good for crumble with increased ratio of butter to dry ingredients
I made it exactly as written with the exception that I added walnuts. I'm not a real sweets person so I did not use enough of the crumbs, so next time I will use more (if I remember).
mmm taste just like brown sugar cinnamon pop tarts! so yummy!!
I substituted white for the brown sugar as I was making a Strawberry Rhubarb and didn't think the molasses in the brown wold work with the tastes.

I've made this a couple of times for pies already. Already my go to for that! I've added toasted coconut, oats, granola, you name it, and it has come out perfect every time. Today's a box strawberry cheesecake coffee cake.

SUGAR FREE VERSION: I made it last night for the first time and I utilized other comments just because I wanted to make sure it was a good turn out since I didn't have time to make it again. I followed the simple recipe but with these modifications:
1.Halved the recipe because I was topping 12 small pastries so 
1/2 c. brown sugar
1/2 c. flour
2-3 tbsp. butter

BUT I used Splenda brown sugar blend and reduced to 1/3 because its so much sweeter than regular brown sugar
And I increased the butter back up to 1/4 cup and used the advice to pop it in the micro for 20 seconds to soften but not melt. 

IT WAS AWESOME !! Thank you! Simple and duplicatable.

Michele
After I made it I sprinkle cinnamon on the top extra touch yes I will make it again
I topped a blueberry pie. yum! making crumb cake next weekend
This is very sweet!! I added oatmeal but it also needs salt!

I love this! I have celiac disease, and gluten free pie crusts just don't go on pretty as toppers. I use this (often with Grandma Ople's Apple Pie) and ALWAYS mix in crushed pecans (candied when possible) to give it an extra crunch and an extra kick. For my fellow celiacs, I use Bob's Red Mill pie crust mix to make this.

4 stars for the recipe as is (pet peeve of mine to rate based on your tweaks & not the original recipe!!) I've used this recipe for many years & it's good, but decided to read a few of the 
 recommendations from others before making this time. 

I made a few changes based on the suggestions of others. I made 2 pies- the first, I added 2 extra TBSP of butter. This pie came out looking like it had a hard candy crust & there was actually a bit of butter sitting on the top of the pie that I had to soak up with a paper towel. The second pie (and MY recommendation for this recipe to be 5-stars) I still used the 2 extra TBSP of butter, but I cut the brown sugar down to 3/4 cup. I was concerned because the mix looked EXTREMELY dry while I was putting it on the pie, but it baked BEAUTIFULLY & looks amazing!! Will definitely be making it this was for future!
Flavor is okay. Unfortunately the top burned in my oven. Might try again, but I doubt it.
it was good
Always make this for my coffee cakes. Yummy
This came out great. I used it on Chef John's Peach Pie
No changes. and yes woulmake again

I used a pastry cutter, and got a sand like mixture and when you squeeze it in your fist it holds together. Sprinkled it on my pie and baked it. It was very good, and better than a top crust. I think it's important to use cold butter.
Very good on top of my apple pie. I suggest using this recipe
WAY too much flour. Not crumbly.

While the recipe is fine and very simple, it was WAY too much for just one pie. Above the directions it showed "2 servings" but servings is not "pies", and maybe that's where the problem lies. One review noted the big lump on top of their pie, and i think this is the reason why, so just make TWO pies instead of one, and you're DOUBLY happy!
Great, quick, delicious topping for fresh apple pie. I do add 1/2 teas. of cinnamon, and 1/2 teas. of nutmeg. Sometimes I add about 3 T. of chopped walnuts. Yummy!
This is a fantastic and easy recipe. Kudos!
Delicious and easy to make. This has become my go-to for my fruit pies, especially cherry and peach pies.
A little on the sweet side, but good texture and flavor.
Made this but it needs more butter, I doubled it
I made my first pie ever, and I used this crumb topping. Everyone loved it! If I can make it - anyone can make it! :-)
Will use this again. I needed a crumb topping for a peach pie without oats. This worked out great

I have made this crumb topping multiple time and it seems as though if you melt the butter it comes out much more crumbly and flavorful.

thanks for reading my review! -Remy
We made this topping for our pineapple mango pie we made it according to the instructions and it turned out perfect will definitely make it again.
I added some oatmeal to this and we loved it .I just like the taste of the oatmeal it gives it more body in my opinion and I put it on Blueberry Muffins with it they were a great hit.

I used it for peach pie topping and found it to be too sweet. I would definitely make it again but will try using half the sugar called for in the recipe. I bet adding some cinnamon would taste real good too.
i added a pinch of salt to the crumbs, but otherwise they were delicious
I halved the recipe for a 9 inch premade pie crust and added 1/2 cup oats. Was very good and simple to make!
Just perfect! I used it to top muffins and breads.
Tasted good, but as another reviewer said, it ended up as a hard crust that we cracked as it was cut.
This is great. Added a pinch of cinnamon. Only used half for a peach pie. The rest I used for a cherry cobbler.Freezes well.

Very easy and quick--and came out tasting great.
I will make regular use of this recipe in future pies.

I have made this crumb topping for a long time, but instead of putting it on top of pies I put it on a cookie sheet. place it in the oven at 350, after 15 minutes stir with fork to make big chunks, bake for another 15 minutes. let cool and eat. its ike a quick and simple cookie. My kids love it.
I doubled the butter in this and pulsed it with te flour and sugar in my cuisinart. Then I crumbled it by hand on top of my peach pie... It was delicious!!
Simple enough recipe, I always use this atop of my cherry pie with homemade crust, I do add a bit of water to the topping for it to crumple properly.
My daughter has made this crumb topping for my home-made apple pie filling. It is wonderful and easy. (I watched her make it.) It was a perfect complement to our apple pie.

I made this last night over an apple pie. I love oatmeal so I only used 1/2 cup of flour and 3/4 cup of quick cooking oats, and I also used dark brown sugar since that's what I had. Husband and son approved!
Simple, easy & yummy recipe!
This was perfect! I used this on a cherry pie and it was fantastic!! I will use this recipe again for sure!! Absolutely Delish!
I wish it was more crumbly. But I think next time I will take the advice of others on how to make more crumb like..other then that it was so good!

This topping covers 2 pies. I use it as the top crust for the apple pies I take to the church bazaar every November. I use unsalted butter, so I sprinkle a little salt into the flour, and then I shake in a little cinnamon. I decrease the brown sugar to 3/4 cup, and cut in the room temperature butter with a pastry blender. I have used this recipe for several years, and it is quick to make and tasty to eat. I use this topping to cover the 5 pies I make from the 40 serving apple pie filling recipe on this site.
Me and my dad tried it..it was too dry..we needed to added a tbsp of water to activate it.
I used 3/4 cup brown sugar and 3/4 cup flour and it made plenty for the topping of my apple pie. I added some cinnamon since that is also in my pie. It tasted delicious!

I increased the butter to 6 Tbl and still found it a bit dry and powdery when you cut your pie. I also cut the sugar to 3/4 cup and added 1/2 tsp cinnamon. I'm going to try it again with 3/4 cup flour, 3/4 cup sugar, 1/2 tsp cinnamon and 6 Tbl butter. It is a good basic. Could also add chopped nuts and oatmeal.
Easy and good.
Worked perfectly on a cherry pie for Thanksgiving. So easy to make and tastes great!

I love streusel-crummy kinda toppings, but I was making a blackbean, pulled rabbit, and quinoa casserole and had nothing to top it with. I swapped out the sugar for parmesan and used this. It was awesome! Now I use this as a savory crumb mix as well as sweet.
Worked perfect for my muffins I stuck the rest in the freezer for later uses
Doubled the butter in order to get it to actually form crumbs. Used the whole amount to cover 9" Cherry Pie. Delicious!
Perfect for a quick delicious topping for my banana bread! Will use this recipe for anything that calls for or may need a crumb topping.
I like to use whole wheat flour as it gives a nutty taste, I use this for all my pies as I like one crust pies.
Great, easy to use recipe.
Tastes good, it's just too hard .
Simple and delicious!
I used some wafer cookie crumbs in place of some of the flour and thought it turned out well!
quick awesome topping.

I loved this!! I did add a couple of dashes of cinnamon. I mixed the sugar, flour, and cinnamon together, then added cubed butter. I mashed the butter cubes into the flour mixture with my hands, then put the mixture in the freezer for 30- 60 mins.
OMGOSH!! Awesome and soooooo easy!

I like this topping well enough, but found it way too much for a single pie. (I put it on a Mrs. Smith's frozen Cherry Pie) I halved all three ingredients. I tried mixing the cold diced butter into the brown sugar/flour mixture by hand with a fork as suggested in the recipe, but it wouldn't combine. After softening the butter (in the bowl with the brown sugar & flour) for 20 secs in the microwave, it combined just fine, using a a hand mixer. Tastes really good!

EVERYONE LOVED THIS. Thank you so much for this recipe. I threw it in the food processor and got it done in a minute. So easy and really was delicious. Would highly recommend and is basically fool proof.

I made this topping separately for a topless blueberry pie, and then spooned it onto the filled pie. It was very good! I would add a little cinnamon to give it a little extra flair.

I got rave reviews from everyone who tried my pie, but I think it would be even better baked onto the top of a pie.
great recipe and makes my pies even better!
Very easy and so delicious! I use this on the canned apple pie filling recipe on this site. I have had rave reviews from everyone I make it for.

I've used this recipe before making a sugar free cherry crumb pie before. I used a store bought pie crust with sugar free cherry pie filling. To make the crumb topping I used a brown sugar subsitute that you can find anywhere. My mom absolutley loved it. She was so excited to be able to eat a pie during the holiday's.
This worked so well on my blueberry pie, great topping!

I added this on top of an apple pie and it worked great! Loved how it became crispy and tasted amazing. Will be adding this to many pies in the future! (Although I find I usually have to add a little more butter than 1/4 cup)
great!!
Used this as a special topper for the holiday pie's my wife is already great at. Made family favorites just a bit more festive. Nice touch on an Apple Pie.
Everyone loved it, will make again
Easy to make and taste great on any pie. I used on top of a caramel apple pie and it was sooooo good!
Not sure if I did something wrong, but I ended up with a large hard top crust that we ended up picking up as a whole and eating with our fingers. Tasted fine, but didn't come out as a crumble.
Super easy & delicious! I took the advice of other readers & reduced the brown sugar to 3/4 C & added an additional 2 T butter. Yum!
I used this recipe for a peach/pear cobbler topping, and omg, was it good! I poked a few holes in the top and I added more butter on it before baking. Fantastic!
I also added cooking oats to it. Great recipe.
PERFECT for apple pie!
I love this topping. It is so easy to make. I suggest melting the butter first to make the crumbs more pliable.
Easy and not too sweet
This did not come out on top of my deep dish black raspberry pie. I had way too much topping for just 1 pie. I had to scrape a bunch off.
Easy to make and adds a nice touch to just about any pastery.
This topping is awesome... it works to cover almost anything... 8-10" pies turn out great with the added sweet and crunchy on top.
Thanks for the recipe! I use it all the time.
Amazing! I used this on my berry cobbler and it was great! I used a little less butter and it was perfect!

I used this for "Oatmeal Banana Cupcakes" from this site and it was perfect. My only complaint is the recipe makes way more than needed! I cut it in half because it sounded like a lot, and I still only used half of it for my whole batch of muffins..and I applied it liberally. But the muffins were so delicious, I just sealed the rest in a baggie and will use it again soon!
So easy! Made topping for cherry pie. Loved it!
